description.narrative: I.R 3.1.1 National standards for equitable child welfare and justice case management are implemented by Government and civil society partners by 2015., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 6: Improved and equitable prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect of children.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF FINANCE AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT
MINISTRY OF JUSTICE LEGAL AND PARLIAMENTARY AFFAIRS

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: I.R 3.1.1 National standards for equitable child welfare and justice case management are implemented by Government and civilsociety partners by 2015.

Number of child protection legislation and policy standards are endorsed by Government, 1) Policy Separated Children (2013), 2) Pre-trial diversion law for children in conflict with the law, 4) Justice for Children Legal Assistance Standards Policy.
